Datatable.LocalizationPair: Minor Factions Multiplier
Multiplier applied to Normal quantity of Minor Civilizations in the Galaxy (Normal is typically 1.5 per player, if using recommended number of players for a given map size)
No minor factions will be generated #FF0000#Will break certain faction quests and render some faction's traits useless#REVERT#
The game will try to generate 50% of the Normal number of minor factions.
1x
The game will try to generate 100% of the Normal number of minor factions.
The game will try to generate 150% of the Normal number of minor factions.
2x
The game will try to generate 200% of the Normal number of minor factions.
The game will try to generate 250% of the Normal number of minor factions.
3x
The game will try to generate 300% of the Normal number of minor factions.

Mercenary Contracting

Having a powerful army is a must if you wish to stand out on the galactic stage, but producing them yourself when you could be erecting large Obelisks is wasteful. By contracting mercenaries instead, this problem is entirely avoided.
Allows Mercenary Attackers to be constructed Mercenaries have higher upkeep, but have improved Privateering
Letters of Marque

A mercenary army is certainly helpful on the front line, but their true power is their "neutrality". Allowing mercenaries to camoflauge themselves as lawless raiders gives you plausible deniability when bombarding an "ally's" shipyards.
Allows Mercenary Hunters to be constructed Mercenaries have higher upkeep, but have improved Privateering
Mercenary Contracting
Enabling this will allow you to research the ability to build minor faction ships.
True
You can research the ability to build minor faction ships.
False
You can not research the ability to build minor faction ships.

System Development projects allow you to level up your star systems by using a combination of luxury resource components that generate special bonuses. Note: No fixed turn cost. Costs 25 [industrycolored], 75 [industrycolored] and 125 [industrycolored] per Tier 1, 2 and 3 Luxury, respectively
[Strat01titaniumColored] and [Strat02hyperiumColored] from Rejuvenation Fields, Black Holes and Solar Nebulas
[Strat03adamantianColored] and [Strat04anti-matterColored] from Asteroid Fields and Collapsing Stars
[Strat05orichalcixColored] and [Strat06quadrinixColored] from Neutron Stars and Nebular Clouds
Note: All strategic resource generation effects require having unlocked the resource exploitation.
Discover at least $SystemObjectiveAmountName More or $Percentage % Total of the Systems in this Galaxy.
Strategic Privacy

When you interact with the world primarily through data, it is difficult to see information networks as truly private. By adopting strict codes of etiquette, the Choir have been mostly able to avoid major political incidents and keep their friends close by proving their trustworthiness. When necessary, this has given the more cunning and ethically flexible entities the tools necessary to manipulate the other participants in the great game.
Cyber Surveillance

It is clear that the extent of our perception is no longer enough; what could the Pilgrim woman be searching for? New instruments will be mounted to our vessels, allowing the detection of stimuli previously dismissed as "useless".
Void Hacking

Having long-since developed an affinity for the cold void of space, the Choir has learned to focus their hacking operations in the vacuum. This not only allows for quicker broadcast transmissions across the galactic void, but information throughput has also been increased, leading to an overall increase in Hacking efficiency.
Echo Condensation

The information broadcasted from our hacking operations seemingly has an effect of causing wraith echoes to form near the source antennae. These freshly formed ghosts are easily convinced to be of use, and are quickly put to work.
Happy Nappers

A natural side effect of the processes planted into Sleepers' cybernetics seems to make them generally more submissive to you as a leader. While not intended, these side effects are certainly welcome.
Burning Metal

By implementing a form of "long distance multi-threading" between backdoors, unused processing power in distant backdoors can be used to perform calculations relevant to an operation being undertaken on the other side of the galaxy. All of this happens in real time, and has no negative consequences towards the lending backdoors.
Happy Haunting

Despite their benevolent nature, wraiths all generally have a love of playing tricks on the residents of the planets their sanctuaries abide on. By repealing Non-Interference Directives written to keep Wraiths safe, mischievious wraiths will be allowed to prank civilians.
Cryptomining

As search engines once did for expertise, now they shall do for the experts themselves. With Choir bodies and minds able to quickly travel through our current systems, everyone from economists to food system biologists can be on-call anywhere and any time.
+4% Hacking Transit Speed (Warp and Starlane) per [backdoor] Backdoor

Scavenger Contracting

For millenia, deep sea scavengers have been a major part of the Lumeris culture and economy, acting as informal ecological cleanup crews and minimizing product loss to war and accidents, and being fought over by the Omokar and Lancellum as a grey area between shipping and mining. By cracking some skulls and getting legislative support from the Arrakyo, we can settle the issue once and for all so there is no question as to the status of scavengers aboard starships.
Enslave factions living on the same planet -5 [happinessColored] per enslaved population +100% [fidsi] from enslaved population

Penance for the Unforgiveable

You see, dear mod user, Chaos has been promising to fix Flotilla Pathing since ESG 1.3. It is now almost ESG 1.5, and yet, there is no Flotilla Pathing rework in sight. Because of this, I will spitefully buff Vodyani by giving them +1% FIDSI per Week he delays from now on. If you wish to play without this, you may make a custom faction and remove this trait.
+1% [fidsi] per [population] on Systems per weeks Chaos has Delayed the Flotilla Pathing Rework
weeks Chaos has Delayed the Flotilla Pathing Rework
